title.value: Swarm-SLAM: Sparse Decentralized Collaborative Simultaneous Localization and Mapping Framework for Multi-Robot Systems
title.quote: Swarm-SLAM: Sparse Decentralized Collaborative Simultaneous Localization and Mapping Framework for Multi-Robot Systems

extractions.description: This paper proposes Swarm-SLAM, a collaborative simultaneous localization and mapping (C-SLAM) system for multi-robot systems in GPS-denied environments. The system is designed to be scalable, flexible, decentralized, and sparse, making it suitable for swarm robotics applications. Swarm-SLAM supports lidar, stereo, and RGB-D sensing, and it includes a novel inter-robot loop closure prioritization technique that reduces communication and accelerates convergence. The paper presents evaluations of Swarm-SLAM on five different datasets and in a real-world experiment with three robots communicating through an ad-hoc network.

type.justification: The paper presents and evaluates Swarm-SLAM, a C-SLAM system.
type.quote: In this paper, we introduce Swarm-SLAM, an open-source C-SLAM system that is designed to be scalable, flexible, decentralized, and sparse, which are all key properties in swarm robotics.

name.justification: The paper presents a C-SLAM system designed for multi-robot systems, with a focus on swarm robotics.
